channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: King Charles to Speak About His Cancer in Televised Message
item.description: A video of the king discussing his “recovery journey” will air on Channel 4 on Friday. He was diagnosed with an unspecified type of cancer last year.

item.title: Honest Company CEO Carla Vernón on being mentored by Walmart’s Doug McMillon
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Sheryl Sandberg breaks down why it’s a troubling time for women in the workplace right now

item.title: Thailand Says Trump Call About Cambodia Conflict Is Set for Friday
item.description: President Trump’s planned intervention comes as the hostilities entered their fifth day and appeared to escalate, and while Thailand moves toward earl...

item.title: Leading the agentic enterprise: What the next wave of AI demands from CEOs
item.description: With agentic AI on board, companies must rethink their very makeup: how work is designed, how decisions are made, and how value is created.

item.title: Asia will get steady growth next year, defying global headwinds, says Mastercard’s chief APAC economist
item.description: Asia is contributing more to global growth than the Americas or Europe, says Mastercard's David Mann.

item.title: Republicans Defy Trump in Indiana, and Hundreds Quarantined in Measles Outbreak
Historic Shift Underway in China’s Economy as Investment Slump Deepens
item.description: Investment in manufacturing, infrastructure and property is expected to fall this year, a remarkable turn for an economy whose growth reshaped the wor...

item.title: Tariffs are taxes and they were used to finance the federal government until the 1913 income tax. A top economist breaks it down
item.description: The last major U.S. tariff law was the Smoot-Hawley Tariff Act of 1930, which established an average tariff rate of 20% on all imports by 1933.

item.title: Why Is It So Hard to Build Big Things?
item.description: Today we look at the state of American inertia.

item.title: How Power Cuts Are Affecting Ukrainians

item.title: Ukrainians, Worrying More About Power Cuts, See U.S. Peace Push as Just Noise
item.description: Many understand the dance their leaders must perform to appease President Trump. But that doesn’t make them any less weary of the rounds and rounds of...
